content.title: Pregnancy Risk in Vascular EDS
content.description: Risks and management considerations for pregnancy in women with vascular Ehlers-Danlos syndrome

key_concepts.details: Historical maternal mortality quoted at 12-25%; may be lower with modern management and surveillance
Risk of uterine rupture, arterial rupture (especially iliac), and postpartum hemorrhage
Highest risk in third trimester and peripartum period
Consider cesarean delivery, high-risk obstetric care, cardiovascular monitoring

content.clinical_significance: Preconception counseling essential for women with vEDS
content.statement: Pregnancy Risk in Vascular EDS is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Genetic-Disorders that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Pregnancy Risk in Vascular EDS helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Pregnancy Risk in Vascular EDS include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Pregnancy Risk in Vascular EDS.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Pregnancy Risk in Vascular EDS. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
